intro: Nothoscordum vigilense, commonly known as the vigilant garlic. It is a flowering plant native to the United States, particularly found in the southeastern region. The plant belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like foliage and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. Its bulbs, though not as well-known as true garlic, have been used in traditional herbal remedies. The species is noted for its resilience and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
